title: Scoreless Elections
outcome: Local councils, rejecting central control, announce the city's first public elections in a generation—fully independent of BCI scoring. Old divisions and buried grievances surface as citizens embrace open participation for the first time, reshaping city politics.

events.description: Autonomous district councils announce Stenograd's first open elections in decades, declaring that all residents can participate regardless of past BCI scores.
Thousands gather to nominate local candidates, including once-flagged citizens and those formerly erased from records. Debates spark hope, but also surface deep-seated rivalries and old resentments.
Oksana Lintz and Lenart Kova oversee a transparent, analog voting process. Directorate loyalists unsuccessfully attempt to discredit the elections, but are ignored by voters.
Preliminary election results reveal a sweeping victory for grassroots and 'ghost' candidates. Celebrations erupt, but some entrenched officials warn of instability without centralized control.
Newly elected councils form a citywide assembly, demanding a full investigation into the BCI era and committing to create a new civic contract based on transparency and inclusivity.
